properties.name: Paddy Murphy's Irish Pub
properties.description: Paddy Murphy's is simply the best pub to go to in Rotterdam. You'll definitely come out Irish after visiting this pub for the first time.

properties.name: Kralingse Plas
properties.description: A massive lake located in the northern part of the Kralingen district. Great for walks, cycling, and some beers on the shore.

properties.name: Cinerama
properties.description: An old-school style cinema usually screening blockbuster titles. If you're bored of the usual cinema look and want to treat yourself to something more elegant, make sure to give this place a chance.

properties.name: LantarenVenster
properties.description: LantarenVenster is the cinema to go to for independent and international titles in Rotterdam. The place itself is very athmospheric and elegant, also on a superb location.

properties.name: Bolder Neoliet
properties.description: My local bouldering gym I frequent on almost a daily basis. Great atmosphere, superb routes, and good coffee. The place itself is not huge, but the people and the vibe make up for it.

properties.name: Dakpark
properties.description: While this park is nothing fancy, it has one thing that you need to check out: bunnies! Plenty of them, actually. I've never seen so many rabbits in a city, but whenever I come here I'm always delighted to see them run around.

properties.name: Yokohama Ramen Saito
properties.description: The best ramen you'll ever have (at least in the Netherlands). Toshimi, the owner and head chef I happen to know personally, is a great guy with a huge heart. His passion towards Japanese cuisine shows in the wonderful taste of his ramen as well. Fun fact: all noodles are made from flour from the windmill next to the restaurant.

properties.name: Vroesenpark
properties.description: Massive park to have your barbeques in and hang out with your friends. You'll find plenty of people here when the sun comes out, so make sure you're there quickly otherwise all the best spots will be taken.

properties.name: Eetcafe Concordia
properties.description: Great place with wonderful people. There's always a good mix of Dutchies and Internationals here. I've had many happy memories here during my bachelor study, considering that it's close to my university.

properties.name: Monk Bouldergym
properties.description: Great place to go to with friends. The boulders are very nicely set, and the place is quite huge. Thier tournaments and events are definitely worth to check out!

properties.name: Kunsthal Rotterdam
properties.description: Your dose of contemporary art can be found here. Kunsthal is a fantastic place to go to every once in a while, with reasonable pricing and a cool little gift section.

properties.name: Rotown
properties.description: One of the best places in town, period. Good music, nice drinks, the location is perfect, and the people are awesome.

properties.name: De Slegte
properties.description: Second hand book store for those who want to explore uncommon titles. The place has an authentic vibe and it is generally a calm place to hand out and discover books. They have an international section as well.

properties.name: Cheap Fashion
properties.description: Second hand clothing store for people on a budget. I've gotten so many neat garments from here. One time I even found an old Hungarian army uniform from the early 90's.
